text:
The installer overwrites the conf/mime.types file, often making an entire site
break.  It is critical that the installer does not overwrite this file, and that
it is preserved when uninstalling.
creator: eliasen@mindspring.com

text:
Actually, if you read the documentation of the TypesConfig directive, you will
see that it specifically tells you to use AddType rather than modifying mime.types
for just this reason.  This allows Apache to upgrade the mime types that it
understands when the server is upgraded.  You should think of mime.types as an 
internal apache file and not touch it.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
I am leaving this as closed, since 1.3 is no longer the recommended version
  for 1.3 users [except if required for older unported modules, and only then
  until that module author has ported to 2.0.]  We don't expect to revisit the
  1.3 installer again.

  Note that 2.0's installer does not overwrite magic, mime.types or httpd.conf,
  but creates a new .default file regardless.  Once can compare the new
  .default to an existing file to determine what has changed [recently].
creator: wrowe@apache.org
